004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.drive;
006
007import static java.util.Objects.requireNonNull;
008
009import edu.wpi.first.hal.FRCNetComm.tInstances;
010import edu.wpi.first.hal.FRCNetComm.tResourceType;
011import edu.wpi.first.hal.HAL;
012import edu.wpi.first.math.MathUtil;
013import edu.wpi.first.util.sendable.Sendable;
014import edu.wpi.first.util.sendable.SendableBuilder;
015import edu.wpi.first.util.sendable.SendableRegistry;
016import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.motorcontrol.MotorController;
017
018/**
019 * A class for driving Mecanum drive platforms.
020 *
021 * <p>Mecanum drives are rectangular with one wheel on each corner. Each wheel has rollers toed in
022 * 45 degrees toward the front or back. When looking at the wheels from the top, the roller axles
023 * should form an X across the robot. Each drive() function provides different inverse kinematic
024 * relations for a Mecanum drive robot.
025 *
026 * <p>Drive base diagram:
027 *
028 * <pre>
029 * \\_______/
030 * \\ |   | /
031 *   |   |
032 * /_|___|_\\
033 * /       \\
034 * </pre>
035 *
036 * <p>Each drive() function provides different inverse kinematic relations for a Mecanum drive
037 * robot.
038 *
039 * <p>The positive Y axis points ahead, the positive X axis points right, and the positive Z axis
040 * points down. Rotations follow the right-hand rule, so clockwise rotation around the Z axis is
041 * positive.
042 *
043 * <p>Note: the axis conventions used in this class differ from DifferentialDrive. This may change
044 * in a future year's WPILib release.
045 *
046 * <p>Inputs smaller then {@value edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.drive.RobotDriveBase#kDefaultDeadband} will
047 * be set to 0, and larger values will be scaled so that the full range is still used. This deadband
048 * value can be changed with {@link #setDeadband}.
049 *
050 * <p>{@link edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.MotorSafety} is enabled by default. The driveCartesian or
051 * drivePolar methods should be called periodically to avoid Motor Safety timeouts.
052 */
053public class MecanumDrive extends RobotDriveBase implements Sendable, AutoCloseable {
054  private static int instances;
055
056  private final MotorController m_frontLeftMotor;
057  private final MotorController m_rearLeftMotor;
058  private final MotorController m_frontRightMotor;
059  private final MotorController m_rearRightMotor;
060
061  private boolean m_reported;
062
063  /**
064   * Wheel speeds for a mecanum drive.
065   *
066   * <p>Uses normalized voltage [-1.0..1.0].
067   */
068  @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
069  public static class WheelSpeeds {
070    public double frontLeft;
071    public double frontRight;
072    public double rearLeft;
073    public double rearRight;
074
075    /** Constructs a WheelSpeeds with zeroes for all four speeds. */
076    public WheelSpeeds() {}
077
078    /**
079     * Constructs a WheelSpeeds.
080     *
081     * @param frontLeft The front left speed [-1.0..1.0].
082     * @param frontRight The front right speed [-1.0..1.0].
083     * @param rearLeft The rear left speed [-1.0..1.0].
084     * @param rearRight The rear right speed [-1.0..1.0].
085     */
086    public WheelSpeeds(double frontLeft, double frontRight, double rearLeft, double rearRight) {
087      this.frontLeft = frontLeft;
088      this.frontRight = frontRight;
089      this.rearLeft = rearLeft;
090      this.rearRight = rearRight;
091    }
092  }
093
094  /**
095   * Construct a MecanumDrive.
096   *
097   * <p>If a motor needs to be inverted, do so before passing it in.
098   *
099   * @param frontLeftMotor The motor on the front-left corner.
100   * @param rearLeftMotor The motor on the rear-left corner.
101   * @param frontRightMotor The motor on the front-right corner.
102   * @param rearRightMotor The motor on the rear-right corner.
103   */
104  public MecanumDrive(
105      MotorController frontLeftMotor,
106      MotorController rearLeftMotor,
107      MotorController frontRightMotor,
108      MotorController rearRightMotor) {
109    requireNonNull(frontLeftMotor, "Front-left motor cannot be null");
110    requireNonNull(rearLeftMotor, "Rear-left motor cannot be null");
111    requireNonNull(frontRightMotor, "Front-right motor cannot be null");
112    requireNonNull(rearRightMotor, "Rear-right motor cannot be null");
113
114    m_frontLeftMotor = frontLeftMotor;
115    m_rearLeftMotor = rearLeftMotor;
116    m_frontRightMotor = frontRightMotor;
117    m_rearRightMotor = rearRightMotor;
118    SendableRegistry.addChild(this, m_frontLeftMotor);
119    SendableRegistry.addChild(this, m_rearLeftMotor);
120    SendableRegistry.addChild(this, m_frontRightMotor);
121    SendableRegistry.addChild(this, m_rearRightMotor);
122    instances++;
123    SendableRegistry.addLW(this, "MecanumDrive", instances);
124  }
125
126  @Override
127  public void close() {
128    SendableRegistry.remove(this);
129  }
130
131  /**
132   * Drive method for Mecanum platform.
133   *
134   * <p>Angles are measured clockwise from the positive X axis. The robot's speed is independent
135   * from its angle or rotation rate.
136   *
137   * @param ySpeed The robot's speed along the Y axis [-1.0..1.0]. Forward is positive.
138   * @param xSpeed The robot's speed along the X axis [-1.0..1.0]. Right is positive.
139   * @param zRotation The robot's rotation rate around the Z axis [-1.0..1.0]. Clockwise is
140   *     positive.
141   */
142  public void driveCartesian(double ySpeed, double xSpeed, double zRotation) {
143    driveCartesian(ySpeed, xSpeed, zRotation, 0.0);
144  }
145
146  /**
147   * Drive method for Mecanum platform.
148   *
149   * <p>Angles are measured clockwise from the positive X axis. The robot's speed is independent
150   * from its angle or rotation rate.
151   *
152   * @param ySpeed The robot's speed along the Y axis [-1.0..1.0]. Forward is positive.
153   * @param xSpeed The robot's speed along the X axis [-1.0..1.0]. Right is positive.
154   * @param zRotation The robot's rotation rate around the Z axis [-1.0..1.0]. Clockwise is
155   *     positive.
156   * @param gyroAngle The current angle reading from the gyro in degrees around the Z axis. Use this
157   *     to implement field-oriented controls.
158   */
159  public void driveCartesian(double ySpeed, double xSpeed, double zRotation, double gyroAngle) {
160    if (!m_reported) {
161      HAL.report(
162          tResourceType.kResourceType_RobotDrive, tInstances.kRobotDrive2_MecanumCartesian, 4);
163      m_reported = true;
164    }
165
166    ySpeed = MathUtil.applyDeadband(ySpeed, m_deadband);
167    xSpeed = MathUtil.applyDeadband(xSpeed, m_deadband);
168
169    var speeds = driveCartesianIK(ySpeed, xSpeed, zRotation, gyroAngle);
170
171    m_frontLeftMotor.set(speeds.frontLeft * m_maxOutput);
172    m_frontRightMotor.set(speeds.frontRight * m_maxOutput);
173    m_rearLeftMotor.set(speeds.rearLeft * m_maxOutput);
174    m_rearRightMotor.set(speeds.rearRight * m_maxOutput);
175
176    feed();
177  }
178
179  /**
180   * Drive method for Mecanum platform.
181   *
182   * <p>Angles are measured counter-clockwise from straight ahead. The speed at which the robot
183   * drives (translation) is independent from its angle or rotation rate.
184   *
185   * @param magnitude The robot's speed at a given angle [-1.0..1.0]. Forward is positive.
186   * @param angle The angle around the Z axis at which the robot drives in degrees [-180..180].
187   * @param zRotation The robot's rotation rate around the Z axis [-1.0..1.0]. Clockwise is
188   *     positive.
189   */
190  public void drivePolar(double magnitude, double angle, double zRotation) {
191    if (!m_reported) {
192      HAL.report(tResourceType.kResourceType_RobotDrive, tInstances.kRobotDrive2_MecanumPolar, 4);
193      m_reported = true;
194    }
195
196    driveCartesian(
197        magnitude * Math.cos(angle * (Math.PI / 180.0)),
198        magnitude * Math.sin(angle * (Math.PI / 180.0)),
199        zRotation,
200        0.0);
201  }
202
203  /**
204   * Cartesian inverse kinematics for Mecanum platform.
205   *
206   * <p>Angles are measured clockwise from the positive X axis. The robot's speed is independent
207   * from its angle or rotation rate.
208   *
209   * @param ySpeed The robot's speed along the Y axis [-1.0..1.0]. Forward is positive.
210   * @param xSpeed The robot's speed along the X axis [-1.0..1.0]. Right is positive.
211   * @param zRotation The robot's rotation rate around the Z axis [-1.0..1.0]. Clockwise is
212   *     positive.
213   * @return Wheel speeds [-1.0..1.0].
214   */
215  public static WheelSpeeds driveCartesianIK(double ySpeed, double xSpeed, double zRotation) {
216    return driveCartesianIK(ySpeed, xSpeed, zRotation, 0.0);
217  }
218
219  /**
220   * Cartesian inverse kinematics for Mecanum platform.
221   *
222   * <p>Angles are measured clockwise from the positive X axis. The robot's speed is independent
223   * from its angle or rotation rate.
224   *
225   * @param ySpeed The robot's speed along the Y axis [-1.0..1.0]. Forward is positive.
226   * @param xSpeed The robot's speed along the X axis [-1.0..1.0]. Right is positive.
227   * @param zRotation The robot's rotation rate around the Z axis [-1.0..1.0]. Clockwise is
228   *     positive.
229   * @param gyroAngle The current angle reading from the gyro in degrees around the Z axis. Use this
230   *     to implement field-oriented controls.
231   * @return Wheel speeds [-1.0..1.0].
232   */
233  public static WheelSpeeds driveCartesianIK(
234      double ySpeed, double xSpeed, double zRotation, double gyroAngle) {
235    ySpeed = MathUtil.clamp(ySpeed, -1.0, 1.0);
236    xSpeed = MathUtil.clamp(xSpeed, -1.0, 1.0);
237
238    // Compensate for gyro angle.
239    Vector2d input = new Vector2d(ySpeed, xSpeed);
240    input.rotate(-gyroAngle);
241
242    double[] wheelSpeeds = new double[4];
243    wheelSpeeds[MotorType.kFrontLeft.value] = input.x + input.y + zRotation;
244    wheelSpeeds[MotorType.kFrontRight.value] = input.x - input.y - zRotation;
245    wheelSpeeds[MotorType.kRearLeft.value] = input.x - input.y + zRotation;
246    wheelSpeeds[MotorType.kRearRight.value] = input.x + input.y - zRotation;
247
248    normalize(wheelSpeeds);
249
250    return new WheelSpeeds(
251        wheelSpeeds[MotorType.kFrontLeft.value],
252        wheelSpeeds[MotorType.kFrontRight.value],
253        wheelSpeeds[MotorType.kRearLeft.value],
254        wheelSpeeds[MotorType.kRearRight.value]);
255  }
256
257  @Override
258  public void stopMotor() {
259    m_frontLeftMotor.stopMotor();
260    m_frontRightMotor.stopMotor();
261    m_rearLeftMotor.stopMotor();
262    m_rearRightMotor.stopMotor();
263    feed();
264  }
265
266  @Override
267  public String getDescription() {
268    return "MecanumDrive";
269  }
270
271  @Override
272  public void initSendable(SendableBuilder builder) {
273    builder.setSmartDashboardType("MecanumDrive");
274    builder.setActuator(true);
275    builder.setSafeState(this::stopMotor);
276    builder.addDoubleProperty(
277        "Front Left Motor Speed", m_frontLeftMotor::get, m_frontLeftMotor::set);
278    builder.addDoubleProperty(
279        "Front Right Motor Speed",
280        () -> m_frontRightMotor.get(),
281        value -> m_frontRightMotor.set(value));
282    builder.addDoubleProperty("Rear Left Motor Speed", m_rearLeftMotor::get, m_rearLeftMotor::set);
283    builder.addDoubleProperty(
284        "Rear Right Motor Speed",
285        () -> m_rearRightMotor.get(),
286        value -> m_rearRightMotor.set(value));
287  }
288}
